question: 休日
sourceMnemonic: When you have a <kanji>rest</kanji> <kanji>day</kanji> you have a <vocabulary>holiday</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>日</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

Every <vocabulary>holiday</vocabulary>, you eat not one, but two <reading>cu</reading>cumbers. <reading>Gee, two</reading> (<ja>きゅうじつ</ja>)? Take it easy!
